title: Man charged after girl, 1, died after being injured at home
text:
A baby girl died after being injured at a property in Manchester (Picture: iStockphoto)

A man has been charged with murdering a one-year-old baby girl.

James Chadwick, 21, from Radcliffe in Greater Manchester, has been arrested along with Chelsea Crilly, 19, who is accused of causing or allowing the death or serious harm of a child.

Police have not said if they are the parents of the dead child.

Officers were first called at around 2.25pm on Wednesday to reports that a one-year-old girl was injured at a property on Cross Lane.

Emergency services attended and the girl was taken to hospital, where she died despite best efforts of specialist doctors.

Superintendent Chris Bridge of Greater Manchester Police (GMP) said: ‘This is a truly devastating incident that has led to a one-year-old girl losing her life.”

Both accused will appear before Manchester and Salford Magistrates’ Court, later today.

Got a story for Metro.co.uk? Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at webnews@metro.co.uk. For more stories like this, check our news page.
description: Man charged a with murdering baby girl, 1, at property in Manchester
